Articles.Content:
@Galileo

Is there an example somewhere of the cfg needed for the stars?

Yeah in order for planets that orbit different suns to use scatterer, the sun they are orbiting needs to have a config set up.

The configs are actually already written technically.. so really all you need to do is add as many suns as you need, and rename the suns to whatever name they were given. this is how you do it:

 

In the scatterer config folder you will use these 2 folders.  

 

 

Inside the Sunflare folder you will see this....This is where I would copy and past as many stars as you need and rename them accordingly. Inside the Sun folder is where you add the textures for custom sun flares.



 

 

When you open the Sun.cfg, you will see this at the top... change the names to whatever the your stars are named.

 

 

 

 

 

Then when you go into the planetList.cfg, you will need to change the name in two places

At the top... This is where you specify the main star. 

 

And at the bottom.. you will need to add the names of all of your stars to this node

 

For you to do this with GN, you will need to add ALL of the planets from every planet pack in GN to the planetList.cfg

 

If a planet pack already comes with scatterer cfgs like GPP or even OPM when its updated, you would just need to add the individual planet scatterer cfgs to the Planets folder.
if this is something you you would want to do, I wouldn't mind helping out. Its not too hard, just tedious.

 

 

Ok I think I laid that out decently... if not, maybe @blackrack can be of more assistance

 

 

 

 

Edited November 13, 2016 by Galileo

5 minutes ago, Galileo said:

The configs are actually already written technically.. so really all you need to do is add as many suns as you need, and rename the suns to whatever name they were given. this is how you do it:

 

In the scatterer config folder you will use these 2 folders.  

 

 

Inside the Sunflare folder you will see this....This is where I would copy and past as many stars as you need and rename them accordingly. Inside the Sun folder is where you add the textures for custom sun flares.



 

 

When you open the Sun.cfg, you will see this at the top... change the names to whatever the your stars is named.

 

 

 

 

 

Then when you go into the planetList.cfg, you will need to change the name in two places

At the top... This is where you specify the main star. 

 

And at the bottom.. you will need to add the names of all of your stars to this node

 

For you to do this with GN, you will need to add ALL of the planets from every planet pack in GN to the planetList.cfg

 

If a planet pack already comes with scatterer cfgs like GPP or even OPM when its updated, you would just need to add the individual planet scatterer cfgs to the Planets folder.
if this is something you you would want to do, I wouldn't mind helping out. Its not too hard, just tedious.

 

 

Ok I think I laid that out decently... if not, maybe @blackrack can be of more assistance

 

 

 

 

thanks @Galileo

I will defer planet configs to each planet pack developer, it's not my responsability to do that, if a planet pack adds scatterer compatibility and GN breaks it, I will fix the cfgs for that planet pack. but I won't write custom ones for all the planets.

For stars, I can easily make a MM cfg that adds all GN stars, provided that MM can be used to edit those lists

thanks @Galileo

I will defer planet configs to each planet pack developer, it's not my responsability to do that, if a planet pack adds scatterer compatibility and GN breaks it, I will fix the cfgs for that planet pack. but I won't write custom ones for all the planets.

For stars, I can easily make a MM cfg that adds all GN stars, provided that MM can be used to edit those lists

 

Yes scatterer now supports MM so you should be good there

I have a suggestion (I know, it takes a long time but please consider). It would be great if the Planet Cyran planet pack was supported. It's a bit like OPM but with one big, very hot planet. This could be difficult/not worth your time as it only contains one planet but It would be great if it was supported. Thanks,

Benji13.

8 hours ago, Benji13 said:

I have a suggestion (I know, it takes a long time but please consider). It would be great if the Planet Cyran planet pack was supported. It's a bit like OPM but with one big, very hot planet. This could be difficult/not worth your time as it only contains one planet but It would be great if it was supported. Thanks,

Benji13.

If it's just one planet,  it wouldn't be hard to throw it into whatever solar system you are playing with. You just need to set its reference body and sma.   If Sigma was to just willy nilly put into OPM,  GPP or whatever other planet pack in Galactic Neighborhood,  then those packs are now effectively not OPM or GPP anymore.

2 hours ago, Galileo said:

If it's just one planet,  it wouldn't be hard to throw it into whatever solar system you are playing with. You just need to set its reference body and small.   If Sigma was to just willy nilly put into OPM,  GPP or whatever other planet pack in Galactic Neighborhood,  then those packs are now effectively not OPM or GPP anymore. 

I have  set of rules when it comes to GN.

One of those is "only one star per planet pack, and only one planet pack per star"

There are a couple of exceptions, but usually i follow them.

I am having problems adding things like rss ,ect to this mod. Can anybody help me with how to actually add a planet pack.

Edited November 19, 2016 by gtoman210

4 hours ago, gtoman210 said:

I am having problems adding things like rss ,ect to this mod. Can anybody help me with how to actually add a planet pack.

Just install this mod by putting the GalacticNeighborhood folder inside GameData and then install the planet pack you want as you would normally would without GN.

Keep in mind that RSS requires RSS-Textures to work

Also, I didn't have time to test compatibility with all packs, so it might be that there are issues with RSS.

I'll take  look later

@Benji13 It's coming to GN, don't worry!

@Galileo I'll make sure it's not a huge memorydump, trust me. Cyran's prodecural anyway, so...

Galactic Neighborhood v0.3.1

Added two new systems to the Galactic Neighborhood, and fixed a couple of them

RealSolarSystem compatibility now requires Sigma Dimensions

 

BEWARE: THIS IS NOT A FULL UPDATE

I haven't tested all Planet Packs, you will need to test the planet packs that you want to use and let me know if there are bugs.

BACK UP YOUR SAVES

 

all the links are available in the OP

 

If you want to follow the development of my mods:  

If you want to buy me a cup of coffee:   

 

Changelog: 

v0.3.1

- Added compatibility with Kerbol Origins
- Added compatibility with Galileo Planet Pack
- Fixed compatibility with Stockalike Solar System
- Fixed compatibility with Real Solar System
- Changed the way stars are added to the Neighborhood

Awesome

@Sigma88 Ever since i installed this mod (great job by the way!) my solar panels are broken (except for SSTU solar panels,but they dont work on the surface for some reason),the weirdest part about it is that they say they are blocked by.... : the sun.... 

Would you know what could cause that/how to fix it (i don't mind workarounds)? 

Thanks.

EDIT:i also appear to have lost Dres from the default solar system,is there any way to re-add it back?

for the dres problem I will need to take a look at logs because I need to understand where things are breaking

no problems, I know what too look for.

most important thing for this issue is the list of mods installed and the MM cache

also, try to avoid extra mods if you can (for the bug report I mean)
